name: Anti-inflamatory blueberry smoothie
ingredients:
-1 cup homemade walnut milk 
 -1 cup frozen wild blueberries 
 -1 tablespoon freshly gound flax seeds 
 -1 tableespoon molasses 
 -1 teaspoon ground cinnamon 
 -handful of ice cubes(optional)
insructions: Soak 1 cup of raw walnuts in water in the refrigerator for 8 hours or overnight. Once soaked, drain and rinse them well and add them to the blender with 4 cups of filtered water. Blend on high for 1 minute or until the walnuts are very finely ground. Strain through a nut milk bag if you like, although I usually skip this step when I use walnuts. Walnut milk can be stored in the fridge for 3-4 days.

name: Savory seasame miso oats
ingredients:
-2 cups of coconutmilk 
 -1 cup rolled oats 
 -1 cup vegetable broth 
 2teaspoons toasted sesame oil 
 -1/4 teaspoon garlic powder 
 -2 scallions 
 -1 tablespoon mellow  white miso paste 
 - sead salt and pepper
insructions: Feel free to adjust the amount of So Delicious Unsweetened Organic Coconutmilk and/or broth for either a thicker or more creamy texture. Aaron prefers his oats on the thicker side (a little less coconut milk and broth), I prefer mine exactly as written. Keep in mind that the oats will continue to thicken and absorb the milk/broth as they cool.

name: Couscous salad
ingredients:
-1 cup uncooked couscous 
 -1 can chickpeas 
 -1 medium nectarine(or peach) 
 -1 1/2cups cherry tomatoes 
 -3/4 cup fresh sweet corn kernels 
 -1 medium cucumber 
 -1/2 cup dried sour cherries 
 -1/3 cup diced red onion
insructions: Cook the couscous according to the package directions. Drain and rinse under cold water. Add the couscous and toss to evenly coat the dressing. Add the chickpeas, nectarine (or peach), cherry tomattoes, corn, cucumber, dired cherries and red onion. Toss to combine and season with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Savory seasame miso oats
ingredients:
-2 cups of coconutmilk 
 -1 cup rolled oats 
 -1 cup vegetable broth 
 2teaspoons toasted sesame oil 
 -1/4 teaspoon garlic powder 
 -2 scallions 
 -1 tablespoon mellow  white miso paste 
 - sead salt and pepper
insructions: Feel free to adjust the amount of So Delicious Unsweetened Organic Coconutmilk and/or broth for either a thicker or more creamy texture. Aaron prefers his oats on the thicker side (a little less coconut milk and broth), I prefer mine exactly as written. Keep in mind that the oats will continue to thicken and absorb the milk/broth as they cool.

name: Lemon herb salmon
insructions: Place the salmon skin side down in a shallow baking dish. (A rimmed baking sheet or 9″ x 13″ casserole pan will work.) Top with the lemon garlic herb mixture. Thinly slice an additional lemon and place the lemon slices on top of the salmon. Place the lemon herb salmon in a 400°F oven for 15 – 20 minutes.

name: Rainbow hummus bowl
ingredients:
-5 ounces baby arugula 
 -3 medium carrots 
 -1 red bell pepper 
 -1 yellow bell pepper 
 -1 cucumber 
 -1/2 cup fermented beets&cabbage 
 -1/3 cup olives
insructions: This recipe is very adaptable to what you have on hand. Use whatever is in season and local and aim for a variety of colors for nutrition and visual interest. Feel free to take full advantage of your grocery store’s pre-prepped veggie selection to make this meal extra speedy!

name: Black bean taccos
ingredients:
-1 red onion sliced 
 -1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil 
 -8 small soft tortillas 
 -1 can black beans 
 -1 avocado 
 -1 cup baby spinach 
 -1 small bunch fresh cilantro 
 -2 scallions 
 -chunky salsa and lime wedges
insructions: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Once the pan is hot, add the olive oil and cook the onion for 3-4 minutes, until fort and slightly caramelized. Season with salt and pepper. Remove the pan from the heat. For each taco, tako one warm tortilla and lay black beans, cooked onion and avocado slices down the middle. Lightly season with small amount of baby spinach and cilantro on top, then sprinkle with scallions. Finish with a scoop of salsa and a drizle of creamy garlic sauce. Serve with lime wedges.

name: Apple snack cake
ingredients:
-1 1/2 cups apple juice 
 -3/4 cup coconut sugar 
 -1/3 cups unsweetened applesauce 
 -1/4 cup melted coconut oil 
 -1 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract 
 -3 cups white spelt flour 
 -1 tablespoon ceylon cinnamon 
 -2 teaspoons baking powder 
 -3/4 teaspoon baking soda 
 -1/2 teaspoon sea salt 
 -2 1/2 cups peeled and diced apples
insructions: Preheat the oven to 350F. Lightly grase an 8x8 inch oan with coconut oil. Line the pan with parchment paper, allowing two sides to and about 1/2 inch over the edges. In large mixing bowl, combine the apple juice, coconut sugar, applesauce, coconut oil and vanilla. Sift in the spelt flour, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Mix the atter until just combined, then fold in the diced apples. Transfer the batter to the prepared pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes aout clean. Let cool completly then slice into squares.

name: Salted dark chocolate fat balls
ingredients:
-2 cups raw walnut pieces 
 -1 1/4 cups unsweetened shredded coconut 
 -1/2 cup raw cashews 
 -1/3 cup raw cacao powder 
 -1 tablespoon chia seeds 
 -heaping 1/4 teaspoon sea salt 
 -1/3 cup unsweetened creamy almond butter 
 -4 soft medjool dates 
 -2 tablespoon melted coconut oil 
 -1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract
insructions: To the bowl of a food processor fitted with the S blade, add the walnuts, shredded coconut, cashew, cacao powder, chia seeds and salt. Pulse until a fine meal forms. Add the almond butter, dates, coconut oil and vanilla. Process until combined. Use a cookie dough scoop or tablespoon to portion the mixture onto a parchment-lined baking sheet. refrigerate 5-10minutes, or until firm enough to easily handle, then use your hands to roll them into bite-sized balls. To decorate, dust wih cacao powder to coat the outside and sprinkle with flaky sea salt. Store in the freezer for up to a month.
